page.title: 18The Village Playing Field
page.content: Braithwell Parish Council brought the land for the Playing Field, which was officially opened in 1980. A 2p Rate precept was levied to buy the land from a local farmer. A football pitch was ready for use first and a club was formed, who play in the local league. Mrs.N.Gardener donated Â£1,000 towards cricket facilities, in memory of her late husband. A Bowling Green is now ready for play and a Club is in formation. Local farmers, villagers and the quarry have all worked together in the preparation of the Playing Field. At present there are two buildings used as changing rooms and as a meeting place for Guides, Brownies, Playgroup, etc. A toilet block was built through the Youth Opportunities Scheme, with materials provided by the Playing Field Committee.
